text:
Created attachment 21811
Core Dump for JVM Crash

Configuration:

64 bit JVM Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.6.0_03-b05 mixed mode)


The error happened when a SOAP Message with attachments was received by a webservice.
creator: naveen.x.chakrapani@jpmchase.com
markt@apache.org
text: Which version of the native connector are you using?

creator: naveen.x.chakrapani@jpmchase.com
text:
We reviewed the dump again and found that it uses the Catalina Connector.
Please Refer dump file provided earlier. We are looking at the stack trace (line 53) that shows
j  org.apache.catalina.connector.InputBuffer.read([BII)I+7

We haven't configured tomcat with any customization. We are just using the default configuration of Tomcat 5.5.23.

The first line of the stack trace shows:
C  [libtcnative-1.so+0xea10]  Java_org_apache_tomcat_jni_Socket_recvbb+0x4

You are using the libtcnative-1.so library which you almost certainly compiled yourselves or downloaded from somewhere since Tomcat doesn't currently ship a binary version of the native connector.

So, again, which version of the native connector are you using? If you don't know, get the latest from http://tomcat.apache.org/download-native.cgi, compile it and see if it fixes the problem.
creator: markt@apache.org
remm@apache.org
text: This is an asynchronous read. You cannot do that, unless you make sure the servlet execution is still going on (and even then, it is not actually allowed). If you would want to avoid the crash, try using the system property org.apache.catalina.connector.RECYCLE_FACADES set to true, to see if it allows detecting the problems in a more stable fashion.

creator: markt@apache.org
text: No response in over 4 months. Closing as INVALID based on Remy's comment.
